description: sketch of figures standing clustered around a column, including figure in URQ who has climbed up on column base to look down; bare-chested reclining figure in front of column with PL hand on chest and PR hand outstretched; verso: Italian text in brown ink
inscription:
Inscription

on back, in black ink: [Andrea Sachi]; on back, in pencil: [(illegible) Italienne XVI s] and [W4 (?)]
medium: Black chalk and brown wash. Touches of pen and ink showing through from writing on verso
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 4, 1977, no. 97; sold for Â£440, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Christ Resurrecting a Paralytic
